FRANKENSTEIN (CONT’D) Count Dracula? Nah, he never does this public stuff. Drac’s old school. He’s about family. And his hotel.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKENSTEIN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The place doesn’t get as many monsters as when we were in hiding, but it’s still got the best food. Dracula samples a squirrel head on a toothpick and gives approval to the GARGOYLE, who is now head chef.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Mmm, getting better. Gargoyle smiles awkwardly.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is that your happy face? Gargoyle nods.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don't ever do that again. INT. MAVIS’ BEDROOM - DAY Dracula playing Mavis’ music box.  HT2-RS/AS 3rd draft rev 4/11/14 3.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKENSTEIN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I think he misses his daughter. Drac is sitting on Mavis’ coffin sadly.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKENSTEIN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: She's been off traveling with Johnny, her human boyfriend, for a few months. Wayne and Wanda burst in.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Drac, what are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Whaa -? I’m just keeping her bed nice and cold for when she comes back.

dialogues.speaker: SHRUNKEN HEAD
dialogues.text: Mmm hmm, your skinny butt gonna be there a long time.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Drac, Mavis says she’s been trying to call you!

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Call me? Oh! «Ha! See that? My skinny butt’s waited long enough! She's coming back! Wayne pulls out his smartphone.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: You gotta get one of these. She wants to video chat.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Video? Whatever happened to turning into a bat and flying to someone? Mavis appears on Wayne’s phone with Johnny. Wayne and Wan peek behind him to get a look.

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS
dialogues.text: Hey, Dad!

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Mavy Wavy! Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: We're in Guacamole!

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Guatemala. Hey Drac! Love you!

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Yes, great, Johnny. Also with the love. So when you coming back? Dracula pushes Wayne aside.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sorry, can’t handle your breath.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: I hear you.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: I mean, right over my shoulder...

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS
dialogues.text: And, Dad... I’m engaged!

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Fantastic. And then you're coming back?

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS
dialogues.text: Dad, did youshear what I said? I’m getting married. To Johnny! Mavis holds up an ENGAGEMENT RING!

dialogues.speaker: WANDA

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS
dialogues.text: Thank you Wanda!

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: No one’s answered my question. Are you coming back?

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS
dialogues.text: Yes. We can’t wait to see you guys!

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Holy rabies!!

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: (teary-eyed) We're all gonna be related!  HT2-RS/AS 3rd draft rev 4/11/14 5.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: She's coming back!!!

dialogues.text: No, no no. You mustn’t give in to your cravings! It’s not good for the baby! He produces a manual “WHAT TO EXPECT WHEN YOU’RE EXPECTIN VAMPIRE” and reads from it. ZOMBIE WAITERS present the di as Dracula mentions them.

dialogues.text: Count Dracula! What’s with this food? Cooked steak!? Who would do that to steak?

dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Mr. Gill, You must have gotten a human dish. He quickly grabs Mr. Gill’s dish and spots a HUMAN COUPLE struggling with a plate of food that is biting them.  HT2-RS/AS 3rd draft rev 4/11/14 18.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I believe this is yours, Mr. Perry.

dialogues.speaker: HUMAN HUSBAND
dialogues.text: Yes, the steak. What’s this food? It’s biting us!

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Yes, that’s the tasting menu. Sorry. Dracula takes the tasting menu dish and gives it to the Gills. Johnny approaches him.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Drac, gotta say, humans are comin’ and everybody's digging the new activities... They walk past a “spinning class” (spider themed).

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Check out the spinning class...

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: If that’s what people are into... Johnny leads him into the new TV ROOM. Monsters and human alike are watching a football game on one monitor. Johnny watches with pride as Drac forces a smile.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: And I told you they’d flip for the TV room! On the other monitor, the GHOSTBUSTERS are fighting ghost The s laugh, but»the monsters scream in horror.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Oh, my! I hope there aren’t any kids watching.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: On it. Johnny tends to some scared young monsters and is berated their MOTHER.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA MOTHER
dialogues.text: (thinks ) What kind of a place shows Kids... that to children? Innocent oh, it’s 8 pm already! ghosts being busted? You Denisovich is up! should be ashamed!  HT2-RS/AS 3rd draft rev 4/11/14 19. INT. DENNIS’ BEDROOM - NIGHT Dracula sneaks in and watches sleeping four year-old Denn small for his age, still goofy looking with curly red hai Dennis wakes up.

dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Just throwing it out there. As Dennis continues Dracula peeks and pokes in his mouth, takes out a fang ruler, measures, marks progress in noteb

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS. DRACULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And he said that, he said Uh huh.... that he had a spiked tail cebause he lived in tropical Uh huh... You don’t say... climates... and cebause he lived in, in the Jurassic Long time ago... yes... period. Mavis enters.

dialogues.text: Dad! Why did you wake him up?

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: What do you mean? It’s after 8!  HT2-RS/AS 3rd draft rev 4/11/14 20.

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS
dialogues.text: I know, Dad, but don’t you remember the new sleep schedule? He’s going to human classes half the day. She indicates a very complicated SLEEP SCHEDULE on the wa MAVIS (CONT’D) If he could just sleep till 2 am tonight it’d be so great for him.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: But Honeydeath, why not take classes with the wolfpups here aat the hotel?! They play fun games like musical chairs!

dialogues.text: The pups are destroying a circle of chairs as gentle MUSI plays. Some smash chairs over each others’ heads. INT. DENNIS’ BEDROOM - NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS
dialogues.text: Dad, I love the wolfpups, but I just think Dennis needs to be around some kids like him. Okay, Dad? (singing to Dennis) Twinkle, twinkle little star, how I wonder what you are...

dialogues.text: (groggy) Mommy, I’m too old for lullaby...

dialogues.text: (not listening to him) What? That’s not how that one goes.

dialogues.text: This is the way most people sing it.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Most people? What’s wrong with (singing) “Suffer, suffer, scream in pain, Blood is spilling from your brain”?

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS
dialogues.text: Daddy...  HT2-RS/AS 3rd draft rev 4/11/14 21.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Come on, you know how I sang it to you... (singing) Zombies

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA, MAVIS
dialogues.text: (harmonizing beautifully) gnaw you like a plum, piercing cries, and you succumb. Dennis is fast asleep.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: “Suffer, suffer, scream in pain, you will never breathe again.” Still works. He looks to Mavey but she’s asleep. Drac smiles proudly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Human Fly, a Zombie Clerk, andya GROTESQUE MONSTER al the FRONT DESK. They are ignoring the phone and enjoying photoboothy APP the Grotesque Monster is playing with on SMARTPHONE. It distorts his own face.

dialogues.speaker: HUMAN FLY
dialogues.text: Oh, my goodness, Leonard! If you really looked. that hideous, I don’t think I could hang out with you!! They crack up laughing as Dracula enters and admonishes t

dialogues.text: Guys! What's the deal? Is this a party? Pick up a phone! The Human Fly hustles to the phone and answers it.

dialogues.speaker: ZOMBIE
dialogues.text: Grrrnnnhhh..!

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: I don’t care if it’s a “cool app”! Now Porridge Head, did you call a hearse for the Gremlinbergs? PORRIDGE HEAD is working on a desktop computer. Dracula looks at his screen, revealing a profile page with every interest listed as “Brains”:  HT2-RS/AS 3rd draft rev 4/11/14 22.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No! You’re checking your Facebook page! Again! Johnny and the AV NERD ZOMBIE enter.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Drac, you need social media to promote the hotel. Right, Clifton?

dialogues.speaker: CLIFTON
dialogues.text: (nerdly voice) Mnnnrrrgghhhh....

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: So, Drac, I wanted to go through some thoughts I had as your human relations coordinating co- assistant.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Sure, of course. It’s a real job. Not a cheap excuse to guarantee Mavis and Denisovich staying here.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Right...so I was thinking. Since we have so many humans now, maybe, some human staff...?

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: What? No, no, I’m not taking jobs away from monsters. We’re accepted but we have a long way to go.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: I know, I’m just thinking about a couple of places. Like, maybe the lounge act? The magician?

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: What’s wrong with Harry Three-Eye?

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: I don’t think the humans dig it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Humans and Monsters watch HARRY THREE-EYE, a three-eyed grotesque magician with wings and tentacles with teeth co out of his head.  HT2-RS/AS 3rd draft rev 4/11/14 23. He wears a tux jacket, bow tie and a small goatee. His ASSISTANT is another grotesque monster with a platinum wi A MONSTER VOLUNTEER stands on stage.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY THREE-EYE
dialogues.text: Tell me, sir, what was your card?

dialogues.speaker: MONSTER VOLUNTEER
dialogues.text: The three of spades. Harry Three-Eye reaches into the Monster Volunteer’s body cavity and pulls out the three of spades, sitting on his stomach.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY THREE-EYE
dialogues.text: Is this your card, my friend? The Monster guests in the lounge applaud politely, but hu are horrified. The Monster Volunteer nods to Harry, like “you're good”. Harry smugly accepts the sparse applause.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: No. Harry’s great. Can’t blame Harry for the crowd not»being hip.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Okay...what about Wayne?

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Are you nuts? He’s my boy!

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Maybe something other than tennis?

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: He’s very knowledgable!

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: That’s not the problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne, in tennis whites, is instructing a male .

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Okay, so what you want to do is lift the racquet right on impact, so you get that nice topspin. Try and hit one.  HT2-RS/AS 3rd draft rev 4/11/14 24. The bounces and hits the ball with his racquet. Wayne instinctively starts to BARK and wildly chases the ball across the court, derailing the lesson. Finally catches t ball and then furiously digs a hole in the clay court.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dracula’s cell phone rings, startling him.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: What is that? What’s the noise? It’s on me! He starts swatting at himself.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: It’s just the cell phone I got you. Clifton’s sending you a text, so you can practice how to write back. Drac tries to press the right button to answer but with h long fingernails it’s very hard.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Ehh... gehhh... it’s not doing it! JOHNNY. I got it... Johnny finds the text.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (xveading) “Dear Drac - Ggnnnnggrrrggh.” Now you._can text Clifton.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Alright, fine! He tries to text but his nails are impossible.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Gah! How do you do this?

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: It’s easy. Look, I'll text Mavis. (texting) “Psyched for Date Night.” See? And now look. She texted right back. “Gotta cancel. Can’t leave Dennis.” (texting) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HT2-RS/AS 3rd draft rev 4/11/14 25.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: “Are we...never allowed...to be alone again? I need...to feel... loved too.” And... send!

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: O-kay. All that taught me is that you're pathetic.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Got it. Maybe you should just get Bluetooth.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Okay. Bluetooth, come over here! BLUETOOTH, a giant blue tooth, hops over with a boing sou

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So now what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All is quiet. INT. DRAC’S ROOM - LATER Dracula has taken off his shirt and is picking out pajama

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: (muttering, mocking Johnny) Hey Dude-man, you need Bluetooth! Hey Dude-man, let’s fire your friends! Hey Dude-man, I’m a Dude- man! The Shrunken Head in his room call over. DRAC’S SHRUNKEN HEAD Yo Dummy! Don’t you remember why you gave him this fake job?

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Yes! To keep them here! Dracula gargles with blood mouthwash as the Shrunken Head speaks. DRAC’S SHRUNKEN HEAD That's right! And what he’s doing’s actually making your daughter want to stay here too. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HT2-RS/AS 3rd draft rev 4/11/14 26. DRAC’S SHRUNKEN HEAD (CONT'D) Seein’ that your grandboy ain’t a monster or nothing.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: He is a monster! He’s just a late fanger. DRAC’S SHRUNKEN HEAD Mmm hmm. And I could be a hand model. Yo - kid turns five ina week. And you know that if he’s not a vampire by then, it ain’t happening.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Oh, it ain’t ain’t happening, baby. DRAC’S SHRUNKEN HEAD Yeah, well if I was you, I’d let that Johnny humanifize the heaven outta this place. So maybe you got a fightin’ chance of keeping that little dimple-butt heresinstead of moving to that crazy suburbia everyone talks about. At “suburbia” Dracula looks stunned. He immediately spins rapidly and emerges in his regular full outfit. DRAC’S SHRUNKEN HEAD (CONT’D) What you doing? I thought you were going to sleep!

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: There’s no time! I gotta fix this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mavis, herself covered with sunblock, shades, and a wide brimmed hat, is walking through the empty lobby with Denn Johnny is trailing her, rubbing some more Corpsertone sunblock (SPF 10,000) on her.

dialogues.text: Honey, just make sure to get my ears again. Thanks. Dracula hustles over, himself covered in sunblock and wea an umbrella tied to his head.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Hey gang!  HT2-RS/AS 3rd draft rev 4/11/14 27.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Hey Papa Drac!

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS
dialogues.text: Dad! What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Why? I wanted to check out all the phat classes my boy takes in town! I guess there’s no better place for him to grow up than right here!

dialogues.text: Uh, sure, Dad! Love to have you. Suddenly, WINNIE, now 6 years old herself, jumps on Denni and hugs him, knocking him down. Dennis doesn’t mind.

dialogues.text: Dennis! I love you! Zing!

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS

dialogues.text: I just love your yummy strawberry locks. Zing Zing! She pulls Dennis’ curly hair and flips him judo style.

dialogues.text: Winnie? Isn’t it past your bedtime?

dialogues.text: I’m gonnasmarry Dennis! Zing! Zing! Winnie runs back through DOGGY DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: He’s a pup magnet. It’s a vampire thing. (reading Mavis’ face) Or not.

Dracula takes more notes. - Very quick shots of Dracula taking more notes at a musi class (kids banging tiny instruments), Swimming class (De loaded up with floaties, fins and kickboard) and a yoga c (mommies stretch with their kids). - Back at hotel, Dracula is cheerfully showing Johnny all notes. The Yetin»sneezes and absentmindedly grabs the parachute like a tissue. - Mavis and Dennis are in a circlesof Monsters and Kids w are passing around a BUNNY. Dennis waves up to Mavis, who watches from pool with horror. Johnny smiles sheepishly next to her. +e * HF

dialogues.text: Dennis and other MONSTER KIDS are banging at kid’s instru and playing the “Bingo” song as Mavis and Johnny sing alo  HT2-RS/AS 3rd draft rev 4/11/14 29. Dracula smiles. They are playfully conducted by PHANTOM O OPERA, their teacher.

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS, JOHNNY AND DENNIS PHANTOM
dialogues.text: THERE WAS A FARMER HAD A DOG More passion!! I want to AND BINGO WAS HIS NAME-O feel the farmer’s pain!

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS, JOHNNY AND DENNIS
dialogues.text: B-I-N-G-O and The OLD GREMLIN LADY suddenly eats Dennis’ toy piano. Den looks confused.

dialogues.speaker: OLD GREMLIN LADY
dialogues.text: I didn’t do that. MOMENTS LATER - Dennis is in another area as Johnny and M are helping him plan his party. We hear Phantom continuin playing the Bingo song on the ORGAN in a Dirge-like arrangement. Dracula catches up.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: And he could be climbing, the cake!

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: I like that, little man! Like he’s climbing a building!

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Hey, uh, didn’t see you guys leave the Phantom’s class. What’s up?

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS
dialogues.text: Oh; we just wanted to talk about Dennis’ birthday party!

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Oh! So much fun!

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS
dialogues.text: Dennis wants a special hero on his cake, right? Who wears a cape and climbs walls?!

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: (smiling) Oh, really?! And who is this hero?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Batman!  HT2-RS/AS 3rd draft rev 4/11/14 30.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: (surprised) Bat...man? What’s his deal?

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Uh, Dennis is getting into superheroes now.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Batman’s a superhero cebause he has all these cool weapons and the, and the batmobile and cebause he climbs walls and he fights bad guys.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Okay...superhero...but why not have a real hero like...okay, forget me for a moment, how about the mummy? The mummy can crash through walls, and turn into a swarm of beetles, and put a curse on anyone!

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: That sounds mean!

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: It's fun mean!

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS
dialogues.text: It's really not a positive role model, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Yeah, costumes can reinforce good behavior too. And it doesn't have to be superheroes. See, you could also dress as a teacher, or a volunteer at an animal shelter.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Okay, please stop. If I wasn't dead, I would kill myself right now. What’s the matter, he’s not allowed to like monsters?!

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I love monsters! Video!

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Oh! You want to show Papa Drac your monster video upstairs?  HT2-RS/AS 3rd draft rev 4/11/14 31.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Yes, yes! Let's see! INT. MAVIS AND JOHNNY’S LIVING ROOM - LATER Everyone waits eagerly as Johnny puts a DVD into their TV

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: This guy’s his favorite. CAKEY THE CAKE MONSTER, who is Muppety and sickeningly El sweet, grabs a huge CAKE.

dialogues.speaker: CAKEY
dialogues.text: Wheeee! Cakey one happy monster! Cakey love Cake! Yummy! Tummy get a tummy ache! Dennis laughs.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Whoa, whoa, whoa. How is»that.a monster?

dialogues.speaker: CAKEY
dialogues.text: Have some cake, Wuzzlelumplebum! WUZZLELUMPLEBUM, another cute animal-like monster, is giv some cake and makes a funny noise to say it’s delicious.

dialogues.speaker: CAKEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Remember, kids, a real monster always shares!

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Shares... yes! When I think monsters - I think shares! What kind of stupid crap are you showing this kid? Why don’t you just drive a stake through my heart? Dennis is shocked. He runs off crying.

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS
dialogues.text: Dennis!

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: It’s fine, he has to cry sometimes to learn not to cry.  HT2-RS/AS 3rd draft rev 4/11/14 32.

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS
dialogues.text: Dad, he’s practically 5 already. Please let this vampire thing go. You can’t just make somebody something they’re not! Dracula leaves. His Shrunken Head shakes his head. DRAC’S SHRUNKEN HEAD Yeah, you done it now. Girl got one fang out the door. Dracula waves his hand quickly and suddenly the Shrunken is framed by DARTS all around. DRAC’S SHRUNKEN HEAD (CONT’D) Oh, okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dracula skulks back in, and walks over to MARTHA’s pictur There’s also a picture of Mavis with Dennis.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Am I really going to lose them, Martha? I don’t think I»could bear it if they left me. I’d feel so alone. I tried to humanificate... humanifize..sswhat’s the word? Wahtever it is, it’s not helping! I’m telling you, that boy, it’s in there! He belongs here! If I could just get some real Grampa time...I know I could get those fangs out of him by his birthday...Grampa time..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drac gets an idea.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: for us... couple time... for them! He knows it's dishonest, so he turns around Martha's pic.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Forgive me honey...you don’t need to hear this. Okay...call the guys. He pulls out his smartphone and struggles again to dial i

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: D-aaaahhhh!  HT2-RS/AS 3rd draft rev 4/11/14 33. DRAC’S SHRUNKEN HEAD Cut them nails, kitty cat!

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Shaddup!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dracula, Frankenstein, Griffin, Wayne, Murray and the Blo are all together shvitzing. Dracula is pacing.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKENSTEIN
dialogues.text: Thanks for invite, Drac. It’s a nice break from my book tour.

dialogues.speaker: GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: Yeah, I was hanging at Wimbledon. Just to be seen.

dialogues.speaker: MURRAY
dialogues.text: I’m supposed to be opening my restaurant with Bruce Jenner, but hey, can’t say no to anvall-paid vacation.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, for you guys, it’s not exactly a vacation. We got to help my grandson.

dialogues.speaker: GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: What? What about all that “we haven’t hung out” stuff?

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: That was batpoop! Look, he’s got a week to become a vampire! Otherwise I don’t know, Mavis might move him to Johnny’s home in Santa Claus!

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: It’s Santa Cruz.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Santa whatever, he can’t live there! We got to change this kid!

dialogues.speaker: FRANKENSTEIN
dialogues.text: Hey you know who could fix him in a snap? Vlad.  HT2-RS/AS 3rd draft rev 4/11/14 34.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: What? We don’t need to call Vlad. We can do this on our own. We’1l take him to all our old haunts and show him each of our special powers, so he learns how to become a (dropping his voice) monster. I can’t talk loud... don’t want humans to hear. AN OLD NAKED MALE HUMAN crosses past them.

dialogues.speaker: MURRAY
dialogues.text: Yike! That’s the most disgusting thing I’ve ever seen!

dialogues.speaker: BLOB
dialogues.text: (jibberish) SUBTITLE: If my butt ever gets that jiggly, kill me.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: I know. It’s a freak show around here. Okay, so listen up. First we got to convince Mavis to go ona vacation, so that we can -- The monsters are still transfixed by the Old Man.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on! Focus here! Dude, put a towel on! No one can think! The Old Man looks puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lavish moonlight barbecue by the dining area. Some HIDE MONSTERS with hairy thick bodies are hula dancing in skir and coconut bras. Dracula is barbecuing with apron “Dark Prince of the Grill”. Hovering at a nearby table are John Mavis, Dennis, Frank, Eunice, Murray, Griffin, Wayne, and Wanda.

dialogues.speaker: EUNICE
dialogues.text: Wow, this is so lavish, Drac, what’s the occasion?

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Oh, no occasion, I just could tell Mavis missed you all.  HT2-RS/AS 3rd draft rev 4/11/14 35.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKENSTEIN
dialogues.text: Awww...that’s nice...always thinking of his daughter.

dialogues.speaker: MURRAY
dialogues.text: And the Hawaiian theme. What a dad! Mavis doesn’t quite get the big gesture but smiles anyway

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Oh, I don’t know, that trip was a happy memory for Mavy. Who’s ready for more Spam? Frank? Dracula slices Spam off of a large, squarish SPAM MONSTER happily obliges.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKENSTEIN
dialogues.text: You know it!

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Hold still, Spammy!

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Hey, Mavis, honey, doesn’t Dennis want to sit at the kid’s table? CUT TO the WOLFPUPS - eating furiously from an ENORMOUS B served by a Zombie. Mavis guards Dennis from the havoc.

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS
dialogues.text: Oh, no, Dennis can’t eat from their bowl. It’s not - I’m sure they don’t have rabies. Dennis has allergies.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: You know, it’s stressful being a mommy, isn’t it Mavy?

dialogues.speaker: MURRAY
dialogues.text: Oh, fo sho. Crazy stress.

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS
dialogues.text: I wouldn't say that, it’s joyful -- As she speaks Winnie jumps over from the bowl.

dialogues.speaker: WINNIE
dialogues.text: You like my dress, Dennis?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Uh huh.  HT2-RS/AS 3rd draft rev 4/11/14 36.

dialogues.speaker: WINNIE
dialogues.text: I wore it for you! Zing Zing! Winnie tackles Dennis, licking him like a dog as Mavis freaks. Dennis giggles, it tickles.

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS
dialogues.text: Holy Rabies!

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: Winnie? Down, sweetie! Wanda calmly sprays Winnie with a water bottle. WANDA (CONT’D) Awww, honey, you really are tense.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Really? You think she is?

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: You should get one of these stress toys, they really help regulate you. Wanda produces a STRESS TOY -— a living, screaming SCRAGG MONSTER whose eyes pop out for real when Wanda squeezes h

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Whoa! That’s not rubber..?

dialogues.speaker: STRESS TOY
dialogues.text: I’m cool with it.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: You. know,,Wanda, now that you mentioned stress...

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS
dialogues.text: Actually, Dad, you mentioned it.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: ...I’m thinking, what if these two did something for themselves?

dialogues.speaker: FRANKENSTEIN
dialogues.text: You mean like, say, going on a little vacation?

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Oh, that’s interesting. You mean make more great memories like Hawaii here? And get a little alone time.  HT2-RS/AS 3rd draft rev 4/11/14 37.

dialogues.speaker: EUNICE
dialogues.text: Yes! That is exactly what you need. Frankenstein winks at Dracula. Eunice is all wound up now Dracula flips Frankenstein more Spam.

dialogues.speaker: EUNICE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're too wrapped up in the kid, honey, and it’s a little scary. Honey, go for it. Don’t forget the coupling.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Wanda and I always make sure we get alone time from the kids.

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: It’s true. Every day at 6 before bedtime. We lock ourselves in the closet for 30 seconds. As Wayne speaks, there are a couple of baby PUPS hanging to his ears by their teeth.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Doesn't matter how hard they kick the door, that time is for us.

dialogues.speaker: GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: I hear you guys. Me and my lady, we love our alone time.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKENSTEIN
dialogues.text: Ah, right, your “girlfriend”.

dialogues.speaker: MURRAY
dialogues.text: The one from Canada?

dialogues.speaker: GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: Hey, she’s invisible. That’s the only reason you guys haven’t seen her.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: (to Mavis) You know, we haven’t gone away since before we got married.  HT2-RS/AS 3rd draft rev 4/11/14 38.

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS
dialogues.text: I know. It would be nice...wait, what about Dennis? I can’t leave him.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Oh, right! Darn, I guess you can’t do it. Dracula looks to the guys for their cue. They are all bus eating Spam. The Pups on Wayne’s head steal his, eating i

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yup, you can’t go on the trip. Right, guys? Exasperated, he subtley mind controls Eunice, who blurts

dialogues.speaker: EUNICE
dialogues.text: Honey, your dad could take care of Dennis!

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Whuhhh? Who, me? That’s not my ulterior motive at all}! JOHNNY. She's right! You just need a little prep, know what vitamins he gets.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Oh, I don’t know if I could handle that?

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS
dialogues.text: Dad, you did a pretty great job raising me.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Well, if you say so.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Come on, Mavis...it’s a good idea.. let's get that zing back. I miss us. Johnny does the pouty face.

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS
dialogues.text: How can I resist that?

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Hooooray! Yes!!! You’re going!! I mean...whatever.  HT2-RS/AS 3rd draft rev 4/11/14 39.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: So where ya gonna go?

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Let’s see, you still haven’t seen Paris, Florence...Tokyo’s nice this time of year -

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS
dialogues.text: You know what I’d really love to see? Where Johnny grew up. Dracula does an insanely long spit take from his disgusti chunky drink. After a while, CUT TO the other side of the powerful stream - the WOLF PUPS are happily lapping it up while getting sprayed hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mavis and Johnny waving goodbye and getting imto hearse t the airport. MAVIS (CONT’D) (to Drac) So it’s rolled oats with apricot, the Aveeno moisturizer after every bath, and...

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: And then thesshea butter on his tush before his pjs. And then 20 minutes with the nebulizer while I read his Learning Factory Phonics book to him --

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS
dialogues.text: And you remember how to video chat?

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Yes, yes, with the phone.

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS
dialogues.text: Thanks for trying so hard Dad. I’m just gonna miss him so much. I love you, Dennis.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I love you!

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS
dialogues.text: Now go back to sleep after we leave!  HT2-RS/AS 3rd draft rev 4/11/14 40.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: I‘1l tell him Mavy Wavy stories every night before bed.

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS
dialogues.text: (hugging Drac) You're the best. I love you.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Now are you sure about going to this California? You know, in Borneo right now there’s the annual Tossing of the Tuna.

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS
dialogues.text: We're good, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: (hugging Dracula) I love you, Drac!

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Yes, yes...with the loves JOHNNY. Will you hug my backpack?

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: No. They get in the hearse and drive away. Dennis reaches up Dracula.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Mmmm. ..bed.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Uh, yes, we'll get to the bed, we all love the bed. But we’re just gonna do one thing first... Another Hearse pulls up. Frankenstein, Wayne, Murray, Gri and the Blob rush toward it, all carrying lots of luggage

dialogues.speaker: FRANKENSTEIN
dialogues.text: Is it shorts weather where we're going?

dialogues.speaker: MURRAY
dialogues.text: Geez, I hope not, I woulda packed my ankle socks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HT2-RS/AS 3rd draft rev 4/11/14 41.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Whatever. Where’s Griffin? Griffin is by the entrance holding up two glasses of champagne.

dialogues.speaker: GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: I'm just saying goodbye to Emily.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Oh, brother.

dialogues.speaker: GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: (girl voice) I’m gonna miss you, so much! (his voice) You have to be strong, honey. Because what we have is unbreakable. He starts making ridiculous kissing sounds.

dialogues.speaker: MURRAY
dialogues.text: (aside) Okay, I gotta call him on this...

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Just let him play it out. (to Griffin) Okay, you two lovebirds! Drink your champagne and let’s get going.

dialogues.speaker: GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: Oh.... okay... He awkwardly pours champagne into his mouth while the oth glass spills to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKENSTEIN
dialogues.text: We can’t say nothing about this?

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: He’s dragging this out. I was trying to get out of here before my kids saw me with a suitcase. Suddenly the Wolfpups charge in and grab onto Wayne, tryi to pull him back in to the hotel.  HT2-RS/AS 3rd draft rev 4/11/14 42. WAYNE (CONT’D) I’1ll be back soon! Daddy’s not going far!...See, now we’re never getting out of here.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: (hypnosis mode) There’s a mouse on the end of your tail! Suddenly, all the wild wolfpups start running in circles, chasing their tails endlessly.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Man, I wish I could do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dracula and the monsters and Dennis pack into the HEARSE. Dracula and his long nails struggle with Dennis’ car seat

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: How do you do this stupid carseat?

dialogues.speaker: FRANKENSTEIN
dialogues.text: You gotta cut those nails, man.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: We just strap our kids down with duck tape. The blob jumps in and squishes everyone inside the hearse

dialogues.speaker: BLOB
dialogues.text: Glurrbleebloo.

dialogues.speaker: MURRAY
dialogues.text: (muffled) Yeah, that ain’t happening.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: (muffled) Fine, put him on the Rascal. Let’s get going. A zombie bellman hooks a RASCAL SCOOTER to the side of th hearse and the Blob slides on. The hearse TAKES OFF quick and the Blob nearly slips off but rides alongside.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Where we going, Papa Drac?  HT2-RS/AS 3rd draft rev 4/11/14 43.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Oh, Denisovich, we’re going to have an adventure! A monstery adventure!

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Yay! Monsters! We’re gonna eat cake?

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: What'd he say?

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: No, no cake on this monster trip!

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: No cake cebause too much cake makes tummy ache! Yay! A monster always shares!

dialogues.speaker: GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKENSTEIN
dialogues.text: We may need more than a week.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Eh, you see, Denisovich, monsters are nice just like you... but when the moon comes out, the real monster fun begins - being scary! Right, guys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On radio, a CURRENT GIRLY POP HIT is playing and the mons all sing along to it.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Guys! Guys! Dracula shuts off the radio.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What is wrong with you?

dialogues.speaker: FRANKENSTEIN
dialogues.text: Come on, everybody likes that song.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: We’re not everybody! We’re scary monsters, remember? Dracula puts a CD into the car’s player.

dialogues.speaker: GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: What are you putting in?  HT2-RS/AS 3rd draft rev 4/11/14 44.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: It’s an audio book. Bigfoot's autobiography. He reads it himself.

dialogues.speaker: BIGFOOT, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Grrrrrhhhhh...Rrrrhhnnngggghhh...

dialogues.speaker: FRANKENSTEIN
dialogues.text: Aw, come on.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: It’s educational! Did you know he was born in Pittsburgh? They continue to listen to the growling as Dennis falls asleep again. REVEAL the Blob is still happily listening the pop song on his headphones in the adjoining Rascal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An AIR TRANSYLVANIA PLANE lands on a runway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEANWHILE, Johnny and Mavis are getting into a rental car driving off. *

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Gotta admit, it’s cool that we’re all here together.

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS
dialogues.text: All?

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Yeah, me and you and my backpack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The backpack is in the back seat with a seatbelt on. Mavi marvels at the mountains outside, but then checks her pho

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS
dialogues.text: Wow. This is gonna be amazing. I want to see everything you did growing up!

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Sure, we can even hit a few spots on the way to my parents.

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS
dialogues.text: Lemme just quickly call home...  HT2-RS/AS 3rd draft rev 4/11/14 45.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Whoa...it’s only 1 am there. Dennis isn’t even up yet.

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS
dialogues.text: Right. I’m sorry, Johnny. I’m just not used to being away from him.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Everything’s gonna be cool. Your dad was so all over it!

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS
dialogues.text: I know. He’s the best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dracula directs Griffin to turn into a dirt road. Dennis napping and bouncing from the bumps.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Right turn here. Denisovich, rise and shine! Boys, this bringing back any memories? Boys?? Frankenstein pulls off his HEADPHONES. He, Murray and Way were all watching and enjoying “The Big Bang Theory”.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKENSTEIN
dialogues.text: Sorry, what?

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Guys! We used to prowl around here when we were in our 100’s! The Dark Forest of. Slobozia! The dirt road gives way to a neatly manicured park. Some night DOG WALKER humans are powerwalking in yoga pants un the bright street lamps. Dennis giggles.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKENSTEIN
dialogues.text: Nice how they built it up.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Ok, left turn! This’1l be good, Frank...the old windmill! Our hangout! I sucked my first blood here. Should be right... The car slows down. The iconic windmill is now a sleek mo WIND TURBINE.  HT2-RS/AS 3rd draft rev 4/11/14 46.

dialogues.speaker: MURRAY
dialogues.text: Cool! Sustainable energy!

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: More cost efficient and safer for Mother Earth!

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Okay, out of the car! Denisovich. You're going to see every monster do his specialty. First, Frank’s gonna show us how he scares people!

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Yay! He’s gonna say, “boo!”

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Yeah, I don’t think “boo”’s ever worked. But that’s why we’re here, to learn from the master!

dialogues.speaker: FRANKENSTEIN
dialogues.text: ‘kay, I‘'1l give it a shot. Frankenstein rears back to scare a couple of JOGGERS who recognize him.

dialogues.speaker: JOGGER
dialogues.text: Hey! Frankenstein!

dialogues.speaker: FRANKENSTEIN
dialogues.text: Hey, how you doin’.

dialogues.speaker: JOGGER
dialogues.text: You’re awesome! Can we take a picture? Is that okay?

dialogues.speaker: FRANKENSTEIN
dialogues.text: Sure. Okay..little selfie action?

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: For real? Jogger #1 selfies a pic with the three of them. Frankenst makes a goofy face.

dialogues.speaker: JOGGER
dialogues.text: Ha, ha. Awesome. Thank you so much!

dialogues.speaker: FRANKENSTEIN
dialogues.text: Have a great day!  HT2-RS/AS 3rd draft rev 4/11/14 47.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Boo!

dialogues.speaker: JOGGERS
dialogues.text: (laughing) Oh...he’s adorable! Dracula swigs from a bottle of “Crypt-o-Bismol - 100% aci

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Adorable. Here comes the ulcer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car pulls into a deep woodsy area.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: This is good! Stop here! They've all climbed out of the hearse into the woodsiest left around there.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, Wayne, it’s your turn. Go kill something. Denisovich, watch this.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: What??

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: What do you mean, what? We talked about this in the spa, remember?

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: I just remember that saggy old naked guy.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: I told you!! Come on! If we don’t inspire Denisovich how’s he going to find his inner monster?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Papa, who’s in a monster?

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Whuh? No, no, your inner monster.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Why can’t we just call Vlad?  HT2-RS/AS 3rd draft rev 4/11/14 48.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Vlad’s not gonna happen.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: What’s a Vlad?

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Nothing. Just, here, have an avocado.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Yay!

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: (smiling but disgusted) It’s from “Mother Earth”! Dracula digs into Dennis’ tote bag of food and supplies a hands him an avocado, which Dennis peels and slices correctly. Dennis shows Frank the slices, offering some. Frank takes the pit in the middle and chews it.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: First of all, you need to dial it down. Second of all, I’m not killing any people. I’m not gonna set monsters back again» just to make your kid like vampires. And thirdly, there’s nothing to kill here! It’s all been --

dialogues.speaker: COYOTE, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Ow-o00! A COYOTE is visible-in the distance. Dracula glares at Wa

dialogues.speaker: COYOTE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ow-o00!

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: (sigh) Great. You know, I haven’t done this in years. We don’t need to kill coyotes anymore. We have Pop Tarts.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Denisovich, you’re going to love this. Wayne’s going to eat that whole coyote. Wayne, go! Wayne approaches the COYOTE and sees two more, also howli  HT2-RS/AS 3rd draft rev 4/11/14 49.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Oh, man... I’m too old for this. Okay... how’s it go again, ow-o00? No, that’s for the moon. I growl. That’s it -- growl, growl, pounce. Okay, here goes. GROWL!!! The Coyotes growl back fiercely and Wayne bolts. WAYNE (CONT’D) Forget it! The Coyotes head toward Wayne. WAYNE (CONT’D) Oh, you gotta be kidding me. Wayne runs back to the hearse. Dennis laughs really hard.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Hey! Where you going?

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: The other way. Everyone dives into the hearse with him as the coyotes ru closer. The Blob dives into his scooter.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Where’s Frank? Frank dives in last, crushing everyone inside the hearse.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKENSTEIN
dialogues.text: (screeching) Hit it! Go! They’re gonna get us! Griffin drives away as the coyotes try to chase the hears

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: (mocking) “Hit it! Go! They’re gonna get us!” And you - some werewolf. Did you really say the word “growl”?

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: I said I was rusty!

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: You're a werewussy. Dennis laughs hard again. So do Griffin and Murray.  HT2-RS/AS 3rd draft rev 4/11/14 50.

dialogues.speaker: GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: Hahaha. Werewussy! What a burn. Suddenly a coyote jumps on the hood of the hearse. Everyo screams, except for Dennis, who laughs hysterically.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Coyote wants to come with us! Griffin swerves the hearse. It causes the Blob’s Rascal scooter to separate and it flies off the road and falls o a cliff. Everyone is quiet for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: He’1ll be okay. He’s blobby. Alright, turn here! Griffin makes a sudden right turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny and Mavis driving through a beautiful street.

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS
dialogues.text: This place is so amazing and scenic! What do you want to show me first?

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Mnn...hard to pick..I did so many things heres Okay, wanna see the tree where I got my first concussion?

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS
dialogues.text: Yes! Wait - what’s that place? Johnny slows down...Mavis has spotted a Minimart. INT. MINIMART —- MOMENTS LATER Mavis is holding up various bags of potato chips and quiz the Iranian CASHIER.

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS
dialogues.text: So you're telling me that I can pick between all these different kinds of chips?

dialogues.speaker: CASHIER
dialogues.text: Yes.  HT2-RS/AS 3rd draft rev 4/11/14 51.

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS
dialogues.text: How do people decide?? The Cashier shrugs. MAVIS (CONT’D) Whoa! Now, what’s that thing that looks like an emerald?

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Mavis drinking a deep red SLURPEE-like drink - she drinks in seconds. MAVIS (CONT’D) Johnny! Have you tried this Slurpée?

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Not...that quickly.

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS
dialogues.text: It comes in 48 flavors! We have to try them all!

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Uh, I don’t know if we have time.

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS
dialogues.text: Why? This place is open all night! Right?

dialogues.speaker: CASHIER
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Twenty minutes later, Mavis hovers over a few dozen empty slurpees. As she smiles, we see her teeth are rainbow colored. She is scratching off a lottery ticket with a quarter.

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS
dialogues.text: Oh, Johnny, this place is so much fun... She reads the ticket... MAVIS (CONT’D) It says “Try again!” Johnny, I get to try again!  HT2-RS/AS 3rd draft rev 4/11/14 52.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Awesome...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is out of the hearse again.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Now we got something! They can’t mess with the old cemetery! You like the cemetery, Dennis?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: This is where all the bad guys go! After Batman gets them!

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Oooh, yes, yes! But wait till you see what a mummy can do!

dialogues.speaker: MURRAY
dialogues.text: ...What can I do?

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Are you kidding me? Was anyone not looking at the wrinkly naked guy?!

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Someone was naked?!

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: (shifting sweetly to Dennis) Yes! And he had a very saggy tushy! Dennis laughs hard. Dracula milks it.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Saggy tushy! Saggy tushy!

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Please don’t remind us!

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Okay. So, in the cemetery - Murray's going to conjure up some dead people and make them alive again!

dialogues.speaker: MURRAY
dialogues.text: Oh, no. There’s people biking.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Do it. Say your little spell.  HT2-RS/AS 3rd draft rev 4/11/14

dialogues.speaker: MURRAY
dialogues.text: I only use that spell to get hot 53. looking dead chicks! I don’t even know who’s in this place!

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: I got a week here, man! Help me out! Murray signs and chants with dramatic Egyptian pantomimin Suddenly a PAIR OF GHOSTS rise from the cemetery. They ar the LOWENTHALS (Mel Brooks, and Martin Short as his wife) elderly Jewish couple with thick accents.

dialogues.speaker: MR. LOWENTHAL
dialogues.text: Hello? Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: MURRAY
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: MR. LOWENTHAL
dialogues.text: You want something? What’d you wake me for?

dialogues.speaker: MURRAY
dialogues.text: Hi, I’m sorry to bother you. Dracula here wanted me to do it.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LOWENTHAL
dialogues.text: Oh, so, Dracula? You do whatever Dracula says?

dialogues.speaker: MR. LOWENTHAL
dialogues.text: You see the sign? Rest in peace? I look like I’m resting now? You sensing any peace?

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Look, Denisovich! Look at these scary ghosts Murray set upon the world!! The Lowenthals wave weakly at Dennis.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: They're nice.

dialogues.speaker: MR. LOWENTHAL
dialogues.text: Did you wake the kid up, too?

dialogues.speaker: MURRAY
dialogues.text: (to ghosts) I’m really sorry. We’ll leave. Do  HT2-RS/AS 3rd draft rev 4/11/14 54.

dialogues.speaker: MR. LOWENTHAL
dialogues.text: No, it’s alright. I’m up now. So how's things?

dialogues.speaker: MURRAY
dialogues.text: Um...you know. Good. We’re just passing through.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I’m a superhero!!

dialogues.speaker: MR. LOWENTHAL
dialogues.text: Enjoy it. Someday you’ll be dead. Who's the big one?

dialogues.speaker: FRANKENSTEIN
dialogues.text: Hi, I’m Frankenstein.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LOWENTHAL
dialogues.text: Frankensteins. Don’t we know a Frankenstein?

dialogues.speaker: MR. LOWENTHAL
dialogues.text: What temple?

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Alright! I don’t got time for this! Just go back to sleep! MR» LOWENTHAL Now? Once I’m up, forget it! Suddenly other similar OLD GHOSTS slowly rise in anger.

dialogues.speaker: OLD,.GHOSTS DRACULA
dialogues.text: What’s all the noise? I was (to the others) having a good dream. All the Oh, boy...listen, guys, let’ yapping woke me! I’m sorry. I just back away slowly... don’t know you. I’m Ted they’1l never notice, they’re Firestone, I died two years old. ago. Was it painless? etc. They back away slowly and then suddenly take off, unnotic as the Ghosts continue.

dialogues.speaker: OLD GHOSTS
dialogues.text: I’m never gonna get back to sleep now. Same with me! People shouldn't be allowed here after 10. (then) Who started this?  HT2-RS/AS 3rd draft rev 4/11/14 55. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny is

dialogues.speaker: MR. LOWENTHAL
dialogues.text: It was those guys!

dialogues.speaker: GHOST
dialogues.text: Let’s get ‘em!

dialogues.speaker: MR. LOWENTHAL
dialogues.text: (dropping energy) Eh.

dialogues.speaker: OLD GHOSTS
dialogues.text: (dropping energy) It’s late. What are you gonna do. They’re too far away already. I was told I shouldn’t run. Anybody get buried with some cookies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: setting up some lights and handing Mavis a frisbee.

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS
dialogues.text: You say this place is better than that mini-mart place?

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. Nothin’ beats my old frolf course - frisbee golf to the layman. Yeah, I_set the club record here back in two thousand four -- Mavis tosses»the frisbee straight into the first basket. mind control, it» then flies to the next, and the next, a on until all mine have been hit. Johnny is stunned.

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS
dialogues.text: That was fun! Oh, hey, it’s after 3 in Transylvania - I’m gonna check on Dennis, okay?

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: (polite) Awesome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis is asleep on Dracula’s lap. Frankenstein is eating a large FRUIT ROLL-UP from Dennis’ snack bag.  HT2-RS/AS 3rd draft rev 4/11/14 56.

dialogues.speaker: GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: Okay, so where next? How about the old inn where I became invisible?

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Nah, that’s boring. With all due respect. Next stop is - Dracula’s phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh no...oh no...it’s Mavis!

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: You gotta answer it. Dracula is struggling with his fingernails again.

dialogues.speaker: MURRAY
dialogues.text: You're pushing too hard. Lighter!

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: All right! Who’s got Denisovich?

dialogues.speaker: GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: I got him! He puts sunglasses on the sleeping boy and holds him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mavis sees a signal on her video chat and finally Dracula

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS
dialogues.text: Dad! What» took so long? INTERCUT with Dracula in the car. He holds the phone clos that Mavis can’t see he’s in a car.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: What? Nothing, Mavy! We’re all great here. How are you?

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS
dialogues.text: Um, everything’s fine. Is Dennis okay?

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Of course! You want to see him?

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS
dialogues.text: Yes! Yes I do!  HT2-RS/AS 3rd draft rev 4/11/14 57. Dracula shows Mavis Dennis. MAVIS (CONT’D) Hi Baby! How are you? Griffin moves Dennis' arms, Weekend at Bernie's style, ma it appear he’s awake. Griffin also does Dennis’ voice.

dialogues.speaker: GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: Mommy! I happy!

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS
dialogues.text: I miss you! Why is he wearing sunglasses?

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Oh, we were playing... it’s a superhero thing!

dialogues.speaker: GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: I’m a superhero!!

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS
dialogues.text: Oh, okay. Which one, honey!

dialogues.speaker: GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: Uh... Sunglasses Man!

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS
dialogues.text: Oh, ho... yow’re so cute.

dialogues.speaker: GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: Cebause I’m Sunglasses Man to the rescue! He makes Dennis look like he’s trying to fly.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: (aside to Griffin) Okay, take it down a notch.

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS
dialogues.text: You sound funny.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: That’s his Sunglasses Man voice He’s been doing it all night. (faking a bad signal) Chhhhh... the signal is bad.

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS
dialogues.text: Okay, Sunglasses Man, remember what every superhero eats to get strong!  HT2-RS/AS 3rd draft rev 4/11/14 58.

dialogues.speaker: GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: Rolled oats with apricot!

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS
dialogues.text: Yay!

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Chhhh...chhhhhh...Mavis are you there? Static...static...

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS
dialogues.text: Yeah, I’m still... Dracula disappears from the screen. He has hung up, fakin disconnect. MAVIS (CONT’D) Alright, I guess he’s having fun.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Course he is. She sighs with some relief.

dialogues.speaker: GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah! Nailed it with the Sunglasses Man! Threw a cebause in there -

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: You gotta be kidding me. Now superheroes eat rolled oats?

dialogues.speaker: FRANKENSTEIN
dialogues.text: If,it’s anything like this fruit rollup...

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: She looked happy up there, didn’t she? She’s gonna wanna move! We gotta fix this kid! Okay, so, next stop - Drac pulls out his cell phone again.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Someone turn on the navigator on this thing. Murray manipulates the navigator.  HT2-RS/AS 3rd draft rev 4/11/14 59.

dialogues.speaker: MURRAY
dialogues.text: Look how light I touch it.

dialogues.speaker: NAVIGATOR
dialogues.text: (creepy Peter Lorre voice) Please enter your destination! Pleeease! I’m begging you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny is waterskiing wildly, going up and down like a dolphin. The lake is lit up nicely from the MOON.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Whoa! Oh yeah! This is how I rolled every summer! They didn’t call me Weird Dolphin Guy for nothing!

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Johnny now driving the boat.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY, (CONT/D)
dialogues.text: Looking good out there. Mavis, in bat form, is on tiny waterskis with the rope ha in her mouth, flying and doing amazing flips.

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS
dialogues.text: Waterskiing’s so much fun!

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Not sure that’s technically waterskiing. We should hit my folks place, I,said we'd be there by now. Mavis switches back into human form.

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS
dialogues.text: Sure! Hey, Johnny...I gotta say, I love Santa Claus. What an awesome place to grow up. Imagine this for Dennis.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Oh...what? This? I don’t know about “awesome”. Maybe “tubular”...but not as awesome as the hotel. Mavis isn’t so sure.  HT2-RS/AS 3rd draft rev 4/11/14 60.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is asleep except Dracula and Dennis, who are laughing, and Griffin, who drives.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Who has a bigger tushy, Frank or Murray?

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Oh, boy, that’s a tough one. I’d say Frank's is bigger, but Murray’s may be mushier. Does that make sense?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Murray's tushy is mushy!

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: That’s my guess. Unless, who knows what’s under that wrapping, maybe it’s not be all tushy. Dennis laughs more.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Maybe there’s a large duck under there. Right next to his tushy. Dennis laughs, then quacks. The Navigator interrupts, in creepy, hyperexcited and tense Peter Lorre-ish voice.

dialogues.speaker: NAVIGATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Right turn! Now!! Here!! You imbecile! !

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Oh, right! Turn, Griffin!

dialogues.speaker: GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: Yes, Papa Drac.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Yeah. This is gonna be good, Denisovich. Scary stuff. Wait and see fellas, this camp will bring the fangs out of anyone.

dialogues.speaker: NAVIGATOR, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: You have arrived at your destination!! Yes! YES!! Small TENTS are set up in the WOODS they are driving thou  HT2-RS/AS 3rd draft rev 4/11/14 61.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Here we are! Wake up, guys! It’s the Vampire Summer Camp I went to as a kid!

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: What’s it, Camp Vamp?

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: No! Who names their camp Camp Vamp? It's Camp Winnepacaca.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our monsters are walking through the camp area. LITTLE VAMPIRE KIDS are everywhere, running and playing.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You see Denisovich, this is where I learned to catch mice, and shape shift, and use my incredible powers and strength! Pretty cool, huh?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Badminton! He excitedly points to a bunch of Vampire Kids playing BADMINTON. As Drac looks around, every activity appears harmless. Some kids are playing TETHERBALL, others are actually singing.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Yes. I don’t remember this badminting. Ah, come over this way! Dracula finds his.old BUNK and walks inside.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Check it out. This is the bunk I slept in! And look -- He walks over to a tiny COFFIN.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Denisovich! This is the coffin I would sleep in!

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: It’s small cebause you were small!

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Yes!!  HT2-RS/AS 3rd draft rev 4/11/14 62.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKENSTEIN
dialogues.text: How do you know it’s yours? They all look the same.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: This is the one. You know what they say, a vampire never forgets.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: I thought that was an elephant. Suddenly the CAMP DIRECTOR, a younger, new age vampire wi gentle, voice, approaches.

dialogues.speaker: CAMP DIRECTOR
dialogues.text: Well, well, is this a night? How ya doin’ folks, I’m Dana, the director.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: How are you?

dialogues.speaker: CAMP DIRECTOR
dialogues.text: We're sure excited to have all you legends visiting.

dialogues.speaker: MURRAY
dialogues.text: Can you believe it, Dracula says he found his old bunk!

dialogues.speaker: CAMP DIRECTOR
dialogues.text: Oh sure! He’s famous for that one! Dana shows them huge pee stain on old bunk. CAMP DIRECTOR (CONT’D) Yessir, that's a bigger landmark at camp than the flagpole. Dennis is laughing hysterically.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Papa Peepee!

dialogues.speaker: GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: Ha! Papa Peepee. That’s a keeper.

dialogues.speaker: CAMP DIRECTOR
dialogues.text: Oh, dear, we don't go for the nicknames here. Kids only get positive reinforcement. Now, what can we do you for?  HT2-RS/AS 3rd draft rev 4/11/14 63.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: I'm very interested in sending my grandboy Denisovich here.

dialogues.speaker: CAMP DIRECTOR
dialogues.text: (puzzled but polite) Oh! This little... red headed... non-fangy lil’ guy?

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Oh, they’re in there. He’s a late fanger. Can you show us some of the drills, like where they catch the mice?

dialogues.speaker: CAMP DIRECTOR
dialogues.text: Can do. Course, now we call it tee- mousing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Camp Director has brought them»allto a tee-ball versi of mice-eating. Mice are on a tee instead of being caught the wild. The kids run up one at a time and grab the mous

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: So they don’t have to catch the mice?

dialogues.speaker: CAMP. DIRECTOR
dialogues.text: Nope. We find this is a good way to build their confidence. One kid is having trouble getting the mouse.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: It’s right there! Kid grabs the mouse and runs off.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: Hokey Pokey. Wanna mouse, Dennis?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: CAMP DIRECTOR
dialogues.text: Any allergies, color restrictions?

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: He can eat a mouse!  HT2-RS/AS 3rd draft rev 4/11/14 64. A COUNSELOR brings out a big bowl of mice and the kids al reach into it and grab mice to eat.

dialogues.speaker: CAMP DIRECTOR
dialogues.text: Not too many! Remember, kids, a vampire always shares!

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Shares. Again with the shares. Are you hearing this, fellas? Fellas? The other monsters are playing Badminton with Campers.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKENSTEIN
dialogues.text: What? Yeah, sounds great! Frankenstein slams the birdie right in a KID’s face. Everyone laughs as Dracula steams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dracula sees a 200 feet tall rickety old diving tower.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Ah, there it is, Denisovich, where Papa learned to fly!

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Ooh, I wanna fly! Pan to reveal the tower is guarded off.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: Ah, yeah... we’re over here now. Vampire kids with instructors are lined up to jump off a foot high tower. All are wearing helmets and padding. Som jump off and retain the padding even when they turn to ba

dialogues.speaker: DANA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Had to scale it down. Insurance. The last Vampire kid jumps and fails, swinging on the rop In background we hear:

dialogues.speaker: VAMPIRE KID
dialogues.text: Help me. Help me.

dialogues.speaker: INSTRUCTOR
dialogues.text: I'll get you down, Grigor. Dracula is silent and furious.  HT2-RS/AS 3rd draft rev 4/11/14 65.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: Ho-key Pokey. See ya at the campfire? EXT. JOHNNY'S PARENTS’ HOUSE - LATER THAT NIGHT A nice woodsy neighborhood in Northern California.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grampa Mike and Grandma Linda are greeting Johnny and Mav

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMA LINDA
dialogues.text: Well, gosh, welcome, you two. This is such a lovely surprise.

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS
dialogues.text: Well, I’ve always wanted to see Johnny’s home.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMA LINDA
dialogues.text: Well, here you are! Now, how does it work, are you up all»night, and sleep all day? Or can you join us for breakfast, like people would? JOHNNY. Yeah...Mavis...?

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS
dialogues.text: Oh, I’m gonna try and sleep tonight.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMA LINDA
dialogues.text: Good! Cuz I bought like the 150 sunblock for you... She produces a huge bottle of 150 SPF sunblock and a ponc GRANDMA LINDA (CONT’D) And I have a sunhat, but otherwise this poncho if you want to be safe.

dialogues.speaker: GRAMPA MIKE
dialogues.text: We can figure that out in the morning, Linda.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMA LINDA
dialogues.text: Okay...ooh, listen...do you hear what we put on the stereo for you? “Thriller” is playing.  HT2-RS/AS 3rd draft rev 4/11/14 66.

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS
dialogues.text: I’m sorry...that is...?

dialogues.speaker: GRAMPA MIKE
dialogues.text: Linda, please don’t. Linda starts zombie-dancing as she sings along.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMA LINDA
dialogues.text: It's close to midnight, and something evil's lurking in the dark -- Mike, help me. Mavis smiles but looks at Johnny confused. Johnny cringes

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMA LINDA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Maybe that one’s before your time. Oh, wait, you’re a hundred twenty something!

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS
dialogues.text: I just never heard current music growing up in Transylvania.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMA LINDA
dialogues.text: Yeah. Transylvania. That was a fun experience. Mike was afraid he’d get eaten and I told him he was being silly. But, now, you just may fall in loveswith Santa Cruz.

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS
dialogues.text: Oh, I do love it! Johnny looks»stressed and makes an unintelligible sound.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMA LINDA
dialogues.text: Oh, and especially for little Dennis not being a monster and all, it’s very kid friendly. Doorbell rings. GRANDMA LINDA (CONT’D) Oh, there they are. You know, we have a couple of mixed families in the neighborhood, so I thought I'd invite them over. They might be nice for you guys to talk to.  HT2-RS/AS 3rd draft rev 4/11/14 67.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandma Linda enters with two couples, CAREN and PANDRAGO who's a freaky-looking but chill monster with a Stoner ac

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMA LINDA
dialogues.text: Hi, Caren, hi Pandragora.

dialogues.speaker: CAREN
dialogues.text: Welcome, Mavis! As Pandragora speaks he casually grabs and eats flying insects.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you're gonna dig it here! Don’t even worry, people are totally cool with the intermarriage thing.

dialogues.speaker: CAREN
dialogues.text: Oh, Pandragora. (cheerful aside to Mavis) He does not read people very well. Not everybody is “totally cool”. The next couple walks in, LORETTA and PAUL, who’s super h with a scraggly beard.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMA LINDA
dialogues.text: Oh, hey yousguys! And this is Loretta, she’s married to Paul, who’s a werewolf.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMA LINDA
dialogues.text: Yes. I was telling Mavis about the other monster/human couples in town.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: I am not a werewolf.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMA LINDA
dialogues.text: Oh... I thought... well, you’re welcome to stay and have some cupcakes! Paul turns and leaves bitterly, along with his wife.  HT2-RS/AS 3rd draft rev 4/11/14 68. GRANDMA LINDA (CONT’D) Anyone else? I made them special for Mavis. The cupcakes’ frosting is a gross eyeball design. Mavis smiles politely. Johnny's brother Brett enters with COZY, a sweet cocker spaniel who gently kisses Johnny.

dialogues.speaker: BRETT
dialogues.text: We're back from the senior home!

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Cozy! How’s my sweet girl? Cozy sees Mavis and attacks her, pouncing barking and nip crazily.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Whoa! Cozy, no! Johnny pulls Cozy off.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMA LINDA
dialogues.text: Oh, dear, I forgot, Cozy has a monster phobia. Just hates them. Cozy dives onto Pandragora, who isn’t fazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, that’s cool. I get it.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMA LINDA
dialogues.text: We better tie her up. And to think she’s a therapy dog! Brett takes Cozy away, still barking at Mavis, who mainta her forced smile. Cozy bursts loose and goes nuts in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Aaugh! I said I’m not a werewolf!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN DOWN to reveal a CAMPFIRE. All the little Vampire Kid are singing around it, led by Dana on guitar.

dialogues.speaker: EVEN IN THE BRIGHTEST SUNNY WEATHER
dialogues.text: (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HT2-RS/AS 3rd draft rev 4/11/14 69.

dialogues.speaker: LIT-ER-AL-LY FOREVER
dialogues.text: (hands in the air) Yay!!!

dialogues.speaker: CAMP DIRECTOR
dialogues.text: Great job, vampires, give yourselves a hug! As the kids hug themselves, reveal Murray and Frankenstei sitting in the circle hugging themselves as when. Dracula walks over and nudges them.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: We're going.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKENSTEIN
dialogues.text: What? Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As we hear another campfire song in the distance, Dracula climbs the tower holding Dennis as»the others follow.

dialogues.speaker: MURRAY
dialogues.text: Why are we doing this?

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: You'd rather be listening to those putrid new songs? What happened to “Michael Row, Your Corpse Ashore”? Or “Kill-baya”? (singing) Someone's oozing pus, my lord... Kill-baya...

dialogues.speaker: FRANKENSTEIN
dialogues.text: We shouldn’t be up here, Drac.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Who’s ready to fly?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Me! Me! Like a superhero!

dialogues.speaker: FRANKENSTEIN
dialogues.text: This thing is rickety, maybe the kid isn’t supposed to fly-- They have reached the top of the tower.  HT2-RS/AS 3rd draft rev 4/11/14 70.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Quiet! This is how they learn. You throw them and they figure it out. It’s how my father taught me!

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I wanna fly now!

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Attabat! You know Papa’s right here if you need him! Griffin removes his glasses.

dialogues.speaker: GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: I can’t watch this.

dialogues.speaker: MURRAY
dialogues.text: Please don’t.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Here... We...... go! Dracula tosses smiling Dennis off the tower. Everyone is horrified except for beaming, calm Dracula. We hear Denni

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS, (0.C2)
dialogues.text: Wheeeeeeeeee! Dracula remains calm.,The others start taking peeks.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKENSTEIN
dialogues.text: He’s still, not flying.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: He will.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: (slightly more distant) Wheeeeeee!

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Still not.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: It‘’ll happen. Beat. A very faint “wheeee”.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKENSTEIN
dialogues.text: This is a tall tower.  HT2-RS/AS 3rd draft rev 4/11/14 71.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: That's why it’s good.

dialogues.speaker: MURRAY
dialogues.text: You should get him.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: He’s gonna fall to his death.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: He’s taking his time. We can hear Dennis screaming.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKENSTEIN
dialogues.text: Drac!

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: I did that my first time. More screaming. All but Dracula are beside themselves.

dialogues.speaker: MURRAY
dialogues.text: He’s getting close to the ground. More screaming. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: You know what, he’s not gonna fly. Dracula shoots out of frame in a flash. As a bat, he flie Dennis as we reveal all the campers shooting with their smartphones as they watch him fall. Dracula swoops and catches Dennis one foot before impact, flying a triumphan loop-de-loop, afterwards.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I told you, Papa’s always here for you.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Yay, Papa! Again! They land as Dana frantically approaches them.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: Oh dear. Oh my devil. We’re gonna have to report this.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: You mean to the papers? I guess it was pretty cool. But I’m not about getting press.  HT2-RS/AS 3rd draft rev 4/11/14 72.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: No, sir, I mean the authorities. I can’t not report child endangerment.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Whoa, listen to me! That was fun! Your singing is child abuse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON the top of the tower.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Should we go down and help him?

dialogues.speaker: FRANKENSTEIN
dialogues.text: Nope. I told him this was nuts. He’s on his own. Frankenstein acts bored and leans against the rail. In the distant background, we see the tall tower. It is starting to tilt on the side Frank is leaning.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: I’m gonna need some information.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Nobody needs to know about this.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: We have to call the boy’s mother. The tower is slowly starting to fall.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: What? No, that ain’t happening.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: I have to follow protocol.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: (quickly hypnotizing) You will not follow protocol.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: I’m a vampire. Can’t be hypnotized.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: (giving up) Oh. Right. Tower falling more. We can faintly see some frenetic acti at the top of the tower.  HT2-RS/AS 3rd draft rev 4/11/14 73.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: Now, please, give me her phone number. Don’t make me call the police. The Camp Kids start screaming as the tower comes closer.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: No one’s calling nobody! Suddenly the tower slams to the ground, landing right on campfire! Frank catches fire and goes insane as everyone scatters. Wayne and Murray chase and scream at Frank, try to get him to calm down. Frank screams in terror and runs aimlessly through different buildings, setting them, and hearse, on fire. EXT. JOHNNY’S PARENTS HOUSE - ROOFTOP - MOMENTS LATER On the ROOF, Mavis and Johnny sit pensively.,We can faint hear “Monster Mash” coming from inside the house.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Sorry about all the songs. I guess they thought you’d like it.

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS
dialogues.text: Why do I feel so weird being here?

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: No, hon, they’re being weird.

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS
dialogues.text: Really? I don’t know anything. Famous songs, Slurpées. I can’t believe all the stuff I’ve missed living inside that hotel. At least if Dennis grows up away from Transylvania, he won’t be weird like me.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Are you nuts? Mavis. You're a blast. You’re so full of life, and curious about everything. If Dennis grows up to be just like you I’1l be the luckiest dad in the world.

dialogues.speaker: MAVIS
dialogues.text: I love you, Johnny Stein. They start to kiss...  HT2-RS/AS 3rd draft rev 4/11/14 74. MAVIS (CONT’D) You know what? As long as we’re all together we'll be happy anywhere. Even the hotel. Johnny steals a quiet “yessss” before they kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our monsters have landed here. Frankenstein and Murray in separate cell with two CELLMATES on the lower bunks.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKENSTEIN
dialogues.text: What’d I tell you guys. Fire bad. Fire. Bad. Frank climbs to a top bunk as one skinny, creepy weird CELLMATE smiles menacingly at Murray, who’s terrified.

dialogues.speaker: SKINNY CELLMATE
dialogues.text: Well, well. Looks like we got some fresh toilet paper.

dialogues.speaker: MURRAY
dialogues.text: Drac...how ‘bout gettin’ us out of here before this guy does something inappropriate? PAN to DRACULA'S CELL, he’s in with Wayne and Dennis, who looks a bit worried forthe first time, a little teary eye

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: You know we have to obey human laws now.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Are we bad guys, Papa Drac?

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: No, no, no, Denisovich, you could never be a bad guy. You’re the nicest boy in the world! We're just playing pretend here, and you’re -

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Batman!

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Uh, yes...the Batman, and I’m the bad guy and you are locking me in jail.  HT2-RS/AS 3rd draft rev 4/11/14 75.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Cebause Batman’s the toughest and strongest guy in the world.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Uh, yes. He’s...the man.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Get in that jail bad guy! Cebause I’m Batman and you’ll never excape!

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Oh, no! Don’t hurt me, Batman!

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: You better be good! Or Murray's gonna sit on you!

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
